JXstKqgGVNzFQHQC-Mok9Q.text: Pizza is new york style but the crust does not have a crisp layer on the bottom.  Slices are big and the sauce is good.  Service is quick and friendly which makes it a good place to pick up a slice for lunch.

c7kKuaIbnPdWtxwOdgDhJQ.text: I have already eaten here twice and loved both what my husband ordered (The Pene Bos), a pizza with lots of meat and my calzone made to my preference (I ordered a calzone with chicken cutlets and mushrooms).  All of it was excellent and the price is very reasonable considering other Central Phoenix restaurants we have been to.  A calzone starts off at rouhghly $6.00 and the add ons are additional but very worth it.  There is something addictive about the sauces they make, so just be warned.  You can't untaste the goodness of it.

7dhOezZqAwxS449cIcZ8kQ.text: Nasty person At the counter it was 815 was told sorry kitchen closed why say you're  open until 9pm

nwOmlFDeE9i41JwIQ6Nxqg.text: We eat here once a month or more. It's a hidden gem. Maybe it's the parking, but this place should be jammed given the value. I go for the Caesar every time, because I've not found better in Phoenix. Valentinos in Santa Monica would not be a stretch comparison. My luv adores the lasagna which is a sometimes special. The pie says Brooklyn, especially the Quattro formmagi. His specials, especially seafood, and Roast pork offerings are sublime values. Get there and save Pino, who is a great host, who remembers his patrons, from the pile of anonymous pizza purveyors

aQwjiO6sY5GQ5FXCMgZXCw.text: I'm not the world's biggest Italian food fan. Mainly because most common establishments just up the tomato and call it pasta without being creative. I have to admit I never thought I'd ever step in this place either, let alone review it with four stars, but I am, and all thanks to a pasta loving friend and an indecisive day.  My review is based solely on their pasta primavera, which, after trying for the first time, I went back on my own to have it again. Three more times. This is huge for me.   The portion is perfect sized and the vegetables which is mainly squash heaven is just perfect. The bread that accompanies it is soft and flavorful also. It's truly the perfect dish for a non tomato/pasta lover like myself.   The staff is really friendly and always strikes up a small conversation when I come in. The prices are reasonable and for the most part, it seems fairly empty every time I've stopped in.   I don't typically crave pasta, but find myself craving this on occasion, which means it's top notch.

vJbJXgO2FQl53Pz0Tkkrtw.text: I dig this place.  I have only ever eaten here for lunch, but I have been here a kabillion times, and I love it.  The only 2 negatives are the parking and the SEMI-cash-only situation.  Meaning, this place DOES take credit cards if your order is over $25!  A lot of other Yelpers have complained that the male owner is a little rude, and his wife (I think?) is the other owner, and she has always been okay.  I guess I am from the east coast, so they seem totally fine to me, but I can see where AZ people think they're a little gruff.  Whatever... I am not paying them to be nice-- I am paying them to cook me some awesome grub.  The best sandwich, to me, is the Italiano because it's the best prosciutto I have ever had.  The texture and quality makes it melt in your mouth.  Also, you can have this sandwich on focaccia (my friends usually choose this option) or the homemade Italian bread, which is my choice.  It's soft and that dusting of flour just makes me all Italo-happy.  It's served with uber-fresh basil as well.  There is a balsamic dressing that is usally served on top, but I ask for it on the side, as I don't like my bread to get mushy.  Finally, the sandwich is pretty big, so it's worth the $10.  (It's gotta be $10 worth of primo prosciutto alone!)  The other key choice is the pizza.  I departed from my beloved Italiano one day (but only because I had already eaten it 2 days before) and ventured toward the pizza.  I am suprised to say that it's really great!  The crust is perfect, and it's just the right amount of doughy.  My advice is to try it.  Get there at 11:30am or 1:00pm for lunch.  Carpool.  Bring cash.  Smell the air when you walk in.  Order the pizza.  Make plans to go back and try the Italiano.  ;)

wKrk6efD98xgT_Oq2v0LtA.text: How to roll at Pino's.  Pino's is one those increasingly rare environs in the USA, a no frills family owned restaurant. First time diners may occasionally get a dose of family dynamic's that don't fit there ethic's or social graces. Hence the occasional negative review. Few people these days understand what it means to work sun up to sun down 6 days a week to make a living. This is the reality of a family restaurant ... you can't always be at your best. I myself have never witnessed any odd behavior, and Pino is the nicest guy you'll ever meet, as is his night time wait staff.   Like many Pizzaria's in the New York area, Pino's is  a cafeteria style high volume take out environment M-F for lunch. Learn the ropes to get feed at rush hour or .. No Soup for You!  Ok I'm just having fun here but you get the idea. Afternoons are slower but I usually avoid that time period because of the limited menu. Evening's are when you want to visit for a True Pino's Al Centro experience. 5-8 PM.   My friend Matt is a regular over here and lets just say the man can eat. Though him I have learned what can really come out of this kitchen, yes some real 5 star specials. Though him I also learned of the "Italian Style" Margarita Pizza ... this thing is off the charts, I actually dream of eating this pie. A super huge funky shaped pizza with a super thin crust ... bubbling with gooey goodness ... Oh Baby Baby. Unfortunately its not on the menu. I myself only get one 50% of the time, and never through the wait staff although they say no problem, a "regular" Margarita Pizza always shows up. (Still very good but not the madman).  My only success is to ask Pino's directly, an if he's busy its not going to happen. The only reason I am sharing this is because if enough of you ask, just maybe, "the italian pie" becomes a permanent feature on the evening menu. My best success is Saturday's around lunch time when it's slow.  Pino's Al Centro is a 30 mile drive for me but I stop in every chance I get. Homemade everything, quality ingredients, straight forward Italian Food. Everything on the menu is a solid 4 star,  a real comfortable family style restaurant with great service and affordable pricing. What's not to like.  "Buon appetito"

oer_WlUgxiJVb117lTgSJA.text: I checked out one of the pasta dishes here for takeout last night. I went with the Spagheti al Capri (Basil, garlic and tomatoes). The pasta was cooked perfectly al dente and the toppings were great. The garlic oil and marinated tomatoes were a great addition. I also had a caesar salad, good stuff. Both came with super good fresh baked bread. All in all, a cool little spot. Next time I'll check out one of the pizzas.

R4UXQQDgaSZ-0eqMWJW77w.text: Love Love Love this place.....Pizza is the best in Phoenix!! Pasta dishes are outstanding....the salads are fresh and incredible!   Must try for anyone form out of town!!  Thanks Pino's for the great food, please open a restaurant in N. Phoenix!!

Kn8ZP8-AZFaymH4gd52m7A.text: Been going here here for years. Recently Pino had a pork and pasta special to die for! The food always exceeds my expectations and I know I can always head here for a quick bite and never be disappointed. Shout out to Roland who ALWAYS remembers me and what I order. You can't go wrong with this small, authentic, and delicious place for the BEST Italian food in Phoenix. I live 30 minutes from the restaurant and don't hesitate to make the drive.

1tYo7mV506PFmPIF9OHufw.text: I feel like I write too many five star reviews, but then I usually only review places I really like, and I really like Pino's.  I also really like Pino, the person.  i met him before I had his pizza, since I run into him at Lux some mornings while I'm having coffee.  Pino really couldn't be a nicer person, and for that reason alone I would patronize his business.  But the pizza....  There's a lot of pizza in the valley, and I would dare to say there's a lot of good pizza in the valley, but when I say "pizza," my family immediately begins to salivate and we all say Pino's at the same time.  I would guess there are at least fifty places to eat pizza between Pino's and my house, but I don't even bother because I know it would be disappointing by comparison.  We always have the same two things.  A giant cheese pizza and a big house salad.  it's enough to feed three skinny people with slices left over for the next day.  I once ate the rest of the pizza there, but I was both sick and happy at the same time.  I can't speak for any of the other food there and will never be able to since I will ALWAYS order his fabulous pizza.  I've been to Italy on several occasions and his pizza is just as good as any I had there.  Of course, Pino is from the old country, so he brings that love for good food with him.    I'm not sure why I'm writing this review at 11:30pm, since they are closed and now I really want a slice.  Why does Pino have to sleep?

PRwHx-w4ShM2WILHEbiByQ.text: ***I paid with a credit card, so I'm not sure what the other reviewer is talking about...maybe there's a minimum at lunch?"***  Family member said this place was AWESOME and had the best white pizza...told a co-worker about it.. Co-worker went and reported back it was really good. "Better pizza than Mamma Mia, and we REALLY like Mamma Mia." So maybe my expectations were too high, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back to Pino's.   Service was laid-back and friendly. Refills were frequent, no complaints on service. Our table of four ordered two caesar salads, two 10" pizzas and one meatball sandwich.   So how was the food? Caesar salad was average. Dressing was served on the side. Normally I appreciate salad dressing on the side, but with Caesar for some reason I always want it mixed in. Quirky, I know, I'm not knocking off a star for that, but just thought I'd mention it. It came with some fresh-baked bread that was AMAZING. Sadly, that bread was the highlight of the meal.  The white pizza was VERY oily. Very. Oily. I also didn't notice that the first ingredient listed on the menu was "fresh tomatoes"...I know, that's my own fault, but if I'd been paying closer attention I would have asked for it without. Fresh tomatoes on pizza = gross. At least they were easy to pick off and didn't leave a "tomato trail" (you tomato-haters know what i'm talking about). There was nothing special about the garlic/basil/cheese on the pizza. it was somehow too much topping without being much of anything. I will say that the crust was amazing. At least the outside of it - you know, the part that wasn't completely soggy with all the oil. Did I mention the pizza was OILY?  The Carnivori pizza was their version of "meat-lovers". I tasted a tiny sliver of it so I shouldn't really judge, but it did nothing for me. Although I will say it was NOT oily, so at least I know that was ONLY a bi-product of the White pizza not just their general method of preparation.  The nibble of meatball sandwich I had was okay. Nothing offensive, but nothing to write home about.   Overall, this place gets a "Meh-I've experienced better" 2-stars. I WANT to like it more. I WANT to give it a higher rating, but something just didn't click. The breads and pizza dough are amazing (baked in-house and you can tell!).  I feel like this place has a REALLY strong foundation, and is SO CLOSE to being amazing...but they fell short.  Everything was "okay"...Even the oily pizza wasn't horrible. No one could complain about anything they ate...it just didn't provide any "Mmmm..."'s...or "OMG - TASTE THIS!" moments (other than the bread). I suppose if I lived or worked in the area, I'd go back and find some sandwich I liked, but it's not in my normal "route" and I didn't find any reason to go back. Except for the bread....I'm tempted to bump up my rating to a 3 JUST for the bread...damn that was good bread.

U25AiObla2UzCw4-bzzQmQ.text: With Pizza A Metro right down the street, I'm not sure why anyone would settle for Pino's.  Uninspired with awful service AND a tiny parking lot.  Heck, if you're too lazy to drive to Pizza A Metro, go to Z Pizza for a pie instead.

Y7usxGeipvRg68LaylCDjQ.text: I went here last night with my girlfriend.  The Staff:  The woman at the counter was clearly put off by the fact we chose to eat at their establishment. We came in without a "hello", or a "welcome", she walked up the counter and stood there staring at us silently, waiting for us to order. We had to look at the menu first, which took about 90 seconds, she was visibly annoyed. She took our order and money without a word, or even a smile. On the way out the door I even said "thanks much", and still she remained silent, instead looking up briefly with what I can only call contempt, as if she was doing me some favor.   The Food:  I had the spaghetti and meatballs. The only way to describe it was sub-par. There was almost no sauce, and the meatballs tasted like they had been soaking in a Sun City hot tub since the time of biblical creation. The bread was burned, and not just a little, it was black on 3 of 4 sides.   The GF had the veggie pizza, and she said it was good. I didn't try it.   Conclusion:  I won't be giving my money to them again. Reading through the other reviews, I have to agree with Joseph S. You can get better food for less money from people who are happy to have your business.   In all, the experience was so bad that it prompted me to write my first Yelp review, but I don't know, maybe I'm just a jerk!

MBbl1O2I7u1ep9b4SYnrKA.text: Everything is still great there AND- they've lightened up on the Debit thing- no more odd restrictions when you pay.  That's gotta be better for business all the way around.  A few more tidbits o' info:  the sausage is homemade, so don't hesitate to get a sausage pizza; a slice of cheese pizza is sublime, needs no toppings at all; the 4-cheese pizza is dreamy, order one; try a pizza with pesto, mozarella and ricotta, you'll weep it's so good.  Cheese steak sandwich is worth a repeat visit as well.

33rElFAD8LJyMHweN1CCng.text: This is by far the best place to get take out pizza! I would love to try their pastas but we never seem to make it past the carnivore pizza.

IrlP8m7EPLCf6O5t95LL3Q.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE !!!! I am more than a lil picky! The pizza is every bit as good as  Pizzeria Biancos  without the long wait ! The crust is superb, fresh herbs , and in house made  sausgage.The quality of the food is  superb and the prices are more than fair  !  Service and atmostphere is warm and inviting !

CSFFy4zyOScneP894_9HFg.text: Love the pizza here!  This place would get 5 stars, except you have to beg for napkins at this place.  They give you 1 napkin (pizza is greasy), and if you go up to the counter, they have them behind the counter so you have to wait for someone at the other end of the counter to come down to get you more than 1 napkin.  Pretty lame.  I guess napkins are expensive now???

8AZ9-R80GDPArAHfQ3c31Q.text: I've been going to Pino's for about 10 years. The food is good, but not as amazing as some reviews would indicate. It's New York style pizza, btw, not Roman style. Mamma Mia's has better NY style and Pizza A Metro has better Roman style, but Pino's is good. The food is on the expensive side for what you get and they nickle and dime you on everything, I mean EVERYTHING. Extra sauce, dressing, red peppers, even paper plates and forks for to go orders incur a charge.   And the staff is usually on the rude side. Not quirky as one reviewer said, but just plain rude. One time they messed up my order and actually point blank refused to make me a new pizza. We ordered a large number of pizzas at work on two seperate occassions and both times they were very late delivering and not apologetic. My boss has since forbidden us to order from them. But if I'm in the mood for their brand of NY style pizza I will stop in occasionally and usually am happy with what I get.  Just be prepared to pay and get less than friendly service.

z9xRYwhBUrUp1tmqylDK4w.text: For you East Coasters, the slices of cheese pizza remind me of Papa Gino's! I do not usually get the traditional Italian food here because I am getting lunch and fear a food coma afterwards, but the slices of pizza and salad are excellent, and the portions are large. The used to not take credit cards, but that since has changed.

Cdnpe-ZAygq9ZY0oclD_Ew.text: As a native New Yorker, Pino's is a godsend in the heart of Phoenix. EXCELLENT New York Style Pizza. Period.   To those yelpers who had a bad experience, go to New York sometime. You'll never survive.

BTl6EJzK76PaZEx813UZCw.text: We dined at Pino's tonight for a Friday pasta fix and it was delicious as always. Carrie served us and she was probably the best part of the dining experience which is saying a lot bc the food was amazing! She was so friendly, provided fantastic service and even added some laughs to the meal. I would definitely recommend coming to see Carrie at Pino's if you're in the mood for Italian. If you can't decide what you want to eat, Carrie will help with that too! :)

6D31ZllGKvviCrXGjrXyhg.text: Very nice food ... cheese pizza is worthy of New York City, but we weren't crazy about the margarita, which was soggy.  Salad was good too ... fresh and tasty.  One issue, however, is parking ... their lot is microscopic, and often full, and I'm always nervous about parking in someone else's lot where they have signs that threaten to tow.  Not as good as Forno 301 or Pizzeria Bianco, but still a solid choice.

62r3aKmQtEWFwX1001gk5Q.text: I don't enjoy writing negative reviews. In a lot of cases bad service is redeemable, what isn't is a rude, arrogant owner that doesn't value their customers enough to handle their complaints with maturity.  My husband and I have patronized this restaurant several times, usually the pizza is decent.That wasn't the case tonight. Instead what we received was pie that would bring any seasoned pizza-lover to tears. The entire center was a soupy, congealed mess that was completely inedible. We chalked it up to a one-time mistake and figured we could just call them up and make it right.  Called Pino's and asked the polite, young cashier if I could speak to a manager, to which she hesitantly replied, "Um, well, my boss isn't here, but I can take a message." I declined, and instead explained the situation to her and asked for a refund. She then informs me that her boss IS there, in fact, he's the one that made it. She asks me to hold while she tells him. She comes back on the phone and nervously says, "He says that the pizza is perfect and that if you want to bring the pizza back for a refund that's fine, because if he makes you another one it's going to be the same."   I felt so bad for this girl, she sounded so uncomfortable. Truthfully I found it pretty pathetic that he had her say it for him. And considering my husband only made it about half a slice in before declaring that it tasted as bad as it looked, I told her he'd be glad to bring it back for the refund.   When he got there, she nicely handled the transaction, and then Pino made his way to the front, opened it, barely looked at it, and then condescendingly said "That's the way it's made, if you don't like that style, no problem", and turned his back to my husband and just walked away. Cool, man. You seem like a really reasonable person.   Maybe Pino and Sammy from Amy's Baking Company are long lost relatives? Needless to say we wont give this place our business again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pino's Pizza Al Centro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Truly a masterpiece&#34;
Photo of Pino's Pizza Al Centro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Perfect&#34;

c1H_Cb6135-s6F7tHRLWhQ.text: Decent Pizza  Was the most expensive pizza I have ever bought... Expected it to be AMAZING.  It was good... Crust was similar to one I would find back East. Chewy base and crispy crust. I ordered it with pepperoni, mushrooms, ricotta, and jalapenos. Toppings were generous though for $3.00 for EACH topping, you'd expect fresh jalapenos and NOT pickled jalapenos. The brine from the jalapenos ruined some parts of the pizza. Cheeses and pepperoni were good.   Italian Salad Fresh ingredients and homemade dressing. I don't think it's worth $12 for a salad that has veggies and no meat. I've paid less for a better salad.   All in all not a bad meal... Just super expensive for the quality and amount.

Ijp3xf_eTzlWh_D4rhlZsA.text: I think I just found my favorite Pizza joint in Phoenix. We ordered their Caesar salad to start which was nice and fresh and large enough to feed three. This followed by a large pepperoni and cheese which was deliciousness! Can't wait to come back and try many of the other items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Pino's Pizza Al Centro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Think I just found my favorite Pizza in Phoenix.

8AVYRv0t4K6aq4unXF8sRA.text: Fantastic and authentic. Only thing missing was the espresso with my canoli!!! The caprese salad was huge. Mozzarrella was great. Pino came over to the table to chat. Nice guy.

m8JMVgP2cSad0QBD-msQVQ.text: I tried the pasta, and am updating my review to reflect that I like this place better now.  I guess their salads just aren't my thing.  The pasta was so much better!  I ordered the penne primavera.  At first I was hesitant to eat what the menu described as a "pink cream sauce" but it turned out to be delicious.  The pasta came with lots of veggies that appeared to have been stir fried (maybe?).  There was broccoli, zucchini, cauliflower, and mushrooms.  If I come back, I will definitely order that dish again!  but the parking situation is still terrible.  I discovered they do have a few additional spots behind their restaurant, but it's pretty scary navigating that alley back there with cars coming and going in both directions as well as people taking out the trash.  you just have to go veeerrry slowly and carefully.

DI5VQx7jo1aP2yyO_96PcA.text: Awesome little Italian place. Every town needs that easy, go-to, pleases everyone Italian joint and this place is it. We had the panzanella salad, margarita pizza and lasagna - all were delicious. This is going to turn into our go-to place.

Xv-WI24QfGqnmMD81gnW9w.text: This was by far the greasiest pizza I've ever come across in my life. The grease is literally pooled onto the slices of pizza.  Given that this restaurant has a four star rating I would assume the other food is pretty good, but I will not be returning to find out.   Not recommended for anyone that is into Midwestern pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Pino's Pizza Al Centro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Large Pepperoni Pizza

hJCm3i9ksrx_3kyww7zP7A.text: Stumbled upon this place thanks to Yelp. The food price is above the norm, like Spinatos, but still worth it. We ordered a plain pepperoni pizza that came out to about $23 for their 16inch. The crust, sauce and pepperoni were all delicious and even reminded me of pizza I had in Rome (i'm serious).   This will stay on my list of DELICIOUS pizza places. Next time i'll be sure to try the other items on the menu, like the lasagna (it looked amazing).

viIinIkbFcLYkIHWuyukbA.text: The pizza was somewhat greasy but still okay, the customer service wasn't too great, it was somewhat hard to order because of what was available, Pino's wife was clearly annoyed we were there but the Cesar salad was great and so was the bread!

xnZCD9XT8LR4oZbR7yN81A.text: This was another lunchtime find a co-worker suggested. The parking is iffy, but the food more than makes up for it. Service was fast, everyone was polite and the food was terrific. I had the chicken parmesan sandwich and I would go back.  Others in our office pick up pizza on their way home and swear by the place, though I have not had the pizza yet to confirm.

DH4cPaVJbm5WBrKvfFWbSA.text: This Italian restaurant is located very near my company's headquarters and the hotel I stay in when I visit here. I have eaten here many times during the last ten years. During that time, I have always enjoyed every meal. Open for lunch and early dinners the pastas, pizzas and other menu items are always good. The lunch crowd is usually larger than for dinner only because of the surrounding commercial area. Counter service only. Parking is somewhat limited.

i1yVCxrw9sx6D18UZm410w.text: This place was really good. We had the four cheese pizza which we really enjoyed! I've never had anything like it. But if you are not a blue cheese fanatic this dish is not for you:)

lIuTPYbK0l75zb0ROL-5NA.text: Excellent Pizza and side dishes. They definitely provide an old school Italian experience.

Kif29Ct6TafNTHieZC-rwQ.text: This is a great little 'home in the wall.'  The food was delicious and our server (I don't know her name...long dark hair w/glasses) was awesome!

31V8qGTx52z8sM2-ajCIKg.text: Plz open more locations, specifically by my house. Thank you.   Pepperoni curls up Tangy sauce  Thin crust  Good cheese  Kalmata olives 4 lyfe Delish bread  Delivery available before 2pm  Use the postmates app for delivery after 2pm like we did and fall in love with your life

a0opHu_cPCfsngHKpqChUQ.text: Really sad to have to downgrade my rating of Pino's. I have been a regular at this restaurant for over a decade, but have decided it's time to say goodbye. Pino is the most gentle, hospitable owner. But that hospitality has been overshadowed by the greedy, inhospitable attitude of whom I shall only refer to as The Dragon Lady. I am not referring to any of the employees, so you will have to deduce   who I am describing. One employee, a delightful server who really made the dining experience so enjoyable; a consummate, old-school professional, resigned this past week. His reason...the infighting had become so unbearable that it not only effected the experience of the patrons, but made the working environment unbearable. Pino is the True professional here, and it is so sad to see his hard work thrown out the window by the most hateful attitude of The Dragon Lady. So sad...

Km17wxrISRTtdizCXqw5-w.text: We were in town for Spring Training and this was close to our hotel.  We tried it out and it was delicious! We had the pizza, calzone, chicken Parm, and Canolis...it was all so yummy!  Highly recommend this place!

AZ825A-sAcbxfBwG-F-r5Q.text: This pizzeria is one of my favorite pizzerias on Phoenix. Their Caesar salad is my favorite. It's usually a great experience when I come in, but today I was very disappointed in their customer service. We came in at about 3pm and the first thing we were told was that most of what was on the menu was not being made, except for the pizza, which is fine, we wanted pizza. After trying to decide between slices or whole pizzas, we felt like we annoyed Pino's wife. She had an attitude because we were confused about our order. She seemed annoyed that we were even there. The other people behind the counter were also not very welcoming. We weren't asked if our food was good or if we needed anything else. It was uncomfortable. As we left, Pino actually came out and said goodbye. He was the only pleasant person there today.

Nt5KP_gPk_Aj8ydARj8m5Q.text: This is the Real Deal when it comes to pizza and calzones.  I loved the pizza at first but now I cannot get enough of the calzones.  The are huge and enough for two meals if you are a girl... men could probably finish the calazone in one sitting and feel more than satisfied.  I drive across town just to feel my craving.  The good thing is, it is inexpensive so that makes up for the gas money.  I'm hooked!

4cuyPTxPLb2-1e6w6EZbzg.text: Found a new love at Pinos. Calzones  with the best Pepperoni in town. Love the Blue Cheese thrown in as well. Too bad your not onpen on weekends and why do you close sooooooooo early?

xhcMV9hlKFU-MIqDTA68sw.text: I love this place but I've actually never tried the pizza. The salads are awesome!! The caprese is one of the best I've ever had, and I love the insalata italiana with gorgonzola. The penne primavera is so good too! P.S. They DO accept credit cards, just not American Express, which sucks because that is the credit card I have for my work so we don't come here nearly as often as I would like to. Also, I've only done take-out orders so I don't know about the service at lunchtime, however the parking situation is really bad!

PU5RU3XxgPebEk0pamI31w.text: This is truly the best place in the city for New York-style pizza.  The staff is always friendly too, and they have good salads and bread if you aren't there for the pizza.  But trust me, you WANT the pizza!

xdzbcXMd38o6JdrWFgUeYA.text: Not a fan of the sauce here, though I know people who swear by it.  Being this close to Z-Pizza, I've not stopped at Pino's for a slice in years.  I do, however, like their calzone's. Plenty of Fridays during Lent I've been satisfied by a massive cheese calzone from Pino's, but even then I didn't use the sauce.

Wt1IMTXnil46zZbjosOYHQ.text: I'm fairly new to town, and have been looking for a great pie in the central valley since arriving.  This is by far the best tasting pizza I've had so far.  I called in, and the guys were very helpful when handling my menuless call.    Upon arriving, they had my pizza ready and were very friendly.  I took it to go and was eager to try it because it smelled heavenly.  I tried the margerita and found it to be oh, so good. I found the ingredients to be of excellent quality.  Delicious cheese, fresh basil, and firm (i.e. not slimy) tomatoes.  The crust was just right- a yeasty, crispy, tender-chewy kind of yum.  Mmmmm...  I savored my slice like it was the last pizza on earth.  Thanks Pinos!  To hell with the bad reviews, your pizza rocks!

F7_HbQp6Se8aAa9Ye5vGmw.text: Pino's is hands down the best pizza in town.  The ambiance is nothing to write home about and neither is the service but the food is delicious.  I love the pizza.  Its just as good as the pizza I've had in Naples.  The penne boscaiola has great flavor and let's not forget the pasta marinara.  If you're looking for a place that lacks pretention and a thirty minute wait, this is it.  Try it out.

IqVI5Mtvw0vJvT8Joc7ieA.text: This is a great place.  My favorite meal is cheese pizza with a glass of red wine.  Pino's get's is perfect everytime.  If you haven't been you should give it a try.

cP_iQM_hQGiy3hi8BIfT8g.text: Co-workers & I have been coming here on-and-off for years, & have never been disappointed. I had the chicken parm for the 1st time yesterday - an excellent sandwich that maintained its flavor when I took it back to the office. (Probably a bit less sauce & a bit more cheese than I'd prefer, but that's just my taste.)  I've had a couple salads & a few pizzas & have liked them all. We don't come here nearly as often as Z Pizza (which is a few doors down), primarily because of the credit card issue -- currently (for lunch at least) they don't accept cards under $10, and lots of people rarely carry cash anymore. (The policy has gotten better over the years.) Pino's also charges extra for pretty much everything - refills, sauce, etc. I can understand the policies - this is not a chain & as far as I know it's still locally owned, so they probably need to watch their bottom line. Still, the policies affect people's willingness to go there, which is a shame, because the food is great.  (Note: parking is tight in front but there's more in back.)

fhxLmzbr94mTZ3Sq9_FhTA.text: Who stops delivering at 2 pm??? I guess Pino's does

O0ppUKef3wr8n8O6p58xmQ.text: Was greeted like "Family" the minute I opened the door with a hearty, enthusiastic welcome from I'm guessing the man himself Pino. What a hell of a guy! Super friendly. My pizza was fuhgetta 'bout it delicious and perfectly made. Extra thin crust was expertly charred with just the right amount of tangy, authentic, home-made sauce and really, really tasty combination of just enough cheese and toppings to satisfy but not choke. LOVE THIS PLACE, LOVE PINO, and LOVE THE PIZZA! Made me feel like we've known each other all of our lives! Grazie Pino!

7Yi6_EvLFg4mjrWjfjQGtg.text: We just had a great meal at Pino's.  For the last three weeks, they have been open 11 am-9 pm on Saturdays.  It sounds like they are trying to determine if there is enough business to open on Saturdays so this may change.  It is definitely worth giving them a call if you crave a great calzone one Saturday evening (pepperoni + meatball = pure goodness).

943Ld8D-SlXBRmDTsVPITw.text: Pino's has good food but I only go when my coworker drags me there because, to be honest, it's kind of a pain in the butt. They only take cash unless your order is over $25, so you have to remember to stop by the bank first. They do have an ATM inside you can get cash from, but off course you're getting dinged with a service charge (and I imagine they're getting a cut of that).    Of course, the coworker dragged a group of us there two weeks ago and the ATM wouldn't work for two of our cards, so we had to bum cash from others in our group. Oh, and they charge for soda refills!

bJuowagPbt6Z5dskvmyv5Q.text: pmg, happened to be next door and was hungry... so i walk over and try their meatball sandwich.. wow the meatball sandwich is my favorite ever, bar none. love the meatballs, they are not dry and hard... just bursting with deliciousness. i highly recommend you give it a go. smiles to all.

B83AkIvHh2nnNV7FU-9Qpw.text: Can't complain -- if you're in the area, grab a slice here! It's frustrating to sometimes not be able to get a slice for dinner, but what can you do. A little secret (shh...): if you spend a decent amount, they'll run your credit card through their secret machine under the counter.

wEjQlevkdKp7H9Nr0uX31w.text: Wonderful food.  Had the Lasagna and would recommend it to anyone and everyone-  TO GO.  The restaurant forgot to make my daughter's order.  It happens, Saturday night and it's busy.  However, bit of an issue when its time to leave and still no food.  Server blamed anyone and everything.  Too busy, cook forgot. large party, blah blah.   Honestly nobody cares about "why" at that point.  Someone say sorry and get the food right?   NOPE.    I asked for them to simply box it up and we could take it with.  Server said ok and they would take the item off the bill.  However, server instead brought it out in a bowl ready to eat.  Our server, ANYONE beyond cashier- all missing.  Maybe serious game Pictionary in the back?  It is still time to check out and - Server reappears and disingenuously states "oh wait we did bring it to the table after all so we are not going to cover the item".   I reminded him we asked them to box, and that rest of the food was ALREADY boxed.  Server says no, we brought it out and I added a meatball for your trouble.  Not really sure how a meatball compensates for that, but its nice he recognized it was a trouble I guess.   All that is laughable and whatever.  I had planned paying from the entree from beginning and the waiver had been a (now hollow) service gesture.  The 1 star is due to the Server himself.  At check out, he blamed Pino for the fact the item wasn't being covered.  I said thanks for letting me know- would share on Yelp.  Server became irate and began heckling our party (3 families) the entire time during check out with sarcastic comments combined with absurd statements about how this was saving his job.    BTW- FEDERAL PIZZA and SPINATOS have equally good entrees and better pizza with the added bonus of pleasant and professional staff

HSJUoye0exGo59HdrUVTbA.text: Located near the corner of W Thomas & N 3rd in Phoenix, Pino's Pizza is a great place for some tasty  Italian food.  Nice casual atmosphere, friendly service, and great tasting pizza and panini's.  Recommendations: 1) Pizza: Try the Carnivori, it's a great tasting "Meateaters" 2) Panini: The Roast Beef Panini is awesome with the focaccia bread.

BskP_-t3mjy2beW5IEHVxA.text: Great pizza. Great pasta. Great salads. I've been there 4 times now and have loved everything I've gotten so far. The meatballs are some of the best I've ever had and the pasta with the vodka sauce is a favorite too. Very glad I found this place!

TLgy3AsABPmtifE8id2Baw.text: We have been here once before. AMAZING food and service was great! We decided to try it again because of our first visit was amazing. We came in at 7 and went and sat at a table. We waited 30 minutes! Not one server came to us. Not even a "hey I will be right with you" "here are some water" we waited giving the benefit of the doubt. Server after server tended to every table around us. But we waited our time. We came here for our anniversary dinner. Such a disappointment.

GvvF4ef4f77Eex5IBD8o4Q.text: They aren't as good as they used to be. I got some slices and the crust was chewy almost to a point of discomfort. It still tasted good but just was not as good as I remembered. Also their parking lot is a complete nightmare during lunch time. Someone literally parked behind everyone's cars for ten minutes so people couldn't leave.

IsaYTLxRP7R7NvFB-OHawQ.text: Very fast Togo service! Owner welcomed me with bread and cheese to sample while drinking my glass of wine. Was a very nice surprise. I totally recommend this place. Portions are huge!!

WYvrly3bY-t0iIQiVwTThA.text: This is one of the best restaurants in the midtown area. I love their margarita pizza. Family-owned, great portions, great service, very tasty food.

CmuTSQGdDRlC2dhscxWflA.text: We've been going to this pizza restaurant for years. We recommended them to lots of friends and family but two weeks ago when we ordered 2 large pizzas (over $40) we realized once we got home our order was not correct. We Immediately contacted the restaurant and they promised Us a free pepperoni pizza on our next visit. When we called to place our order for the replacement they did not honor their promise and told us we had to pay for a large cheese and only the pepperonis would be free and it came straight from the owner Pino.  We were very disappointed and shocked that the owner of this restaurant does not value his customers we will never recommend this place to anyone nor ever eat there again.

ExZ567-NZqVCJeijTx4kEg.text: Visiting the area for Spring training and drove by Pino's with 3 hungry teenage boys.  The pizzas were huge, the salad super refreshing and healthy with delicious red pepper and basil, oh gosh thinking about it makes my mouth water.  Great service and delicious food!  Wish I had more time here to eat my way through the menu!

JKRS-wDyBT3sLuGCjhrhZA.text: Piano's is good, but not my favorite. The people are very nice and the place is always busy. The ingredients are fresh, but I wish there was more browning on the crust.

Mx80GOLHE-opV8SSEX3sOg.text: Staff is very rude. I was using my Apple Pay and had to train the cashier how to do it, and then she begrudgingly did it. And then mouthed under her breath that "paying with your phone is stupid" ...with that out of the way the cashier then complained that you can't use a card unless it's above $10. And then someone in the back said something rude like "Just run it so he can get the fuck out of here"...  Then came the poor excuse of a pizza slice. I opened it up to realize it's greasy as ever, and toppings were splattered to the side of the box.   Never return here again and I'll tell friends to never come here again. The food used to be good and then quality just started to slip down the drain. If you can't afford to run a credit card for a $6 transaction, how stable is your business model when the pizza place NEXT DOOR has no issues whatsoever?

zDtBcgwFWwhYCAmer9u1PA.text: This place is so good we usually get a pepperoni pizza with one of the salads the calzones are really good to.

2ZYtAGtLsAIZpIFGo8Mpzw.text: So, I get cravings for things every now and again. Today for lunch I had a craving for a nice Italian Chicken Parm sandwich. Having not yet tried Pino's Pizza, I went in for lunch and ordered take out. I had a beer while I waited and since the counter service was pleasant I left a $2 tip.  Have you ever felt like you got ripped off?  I mean, $20 for a sandwich and a beer for lunch.....wow.  You'd think it was free range chicken imported from chicken heaven.  But the bill wasn't the worst part.  The sandwich ???  Noooooooooooooooooooo!!  If I wanted boiled chicken breast, with a tablespoon of red sauce with mozzarella cheese, I would have gone to the local retirement village.  This sandwich, though portioned right was AWFUL. The best thing about it was the roll. A chicken parm sandwich starts with italian bread crumb battered chicken, pan fried, with oh....let's say PARMESAN cheese, perhaps some melty provolone and a nice smothering of a FLAVORFUL red sauce.  This had NONE of those components. First time, shame on you, there will be no second time despite the prior decent reviews.

M3rWrOIbOUD7nEpPabp7Tw.text: I've eaten at Pino's more times than I can count.  It's been a while because I live far and have been busy.  I went in for dinner last night with a friend and feel the need to do SOMEthing to spread the word about this little gem of a place with FRESH, authentic and delicious food.    I'm Italian raised by FOB parents with a huge extended (Italian) family and lots of great Italian food lovingly made and offered at every turn.  Last night I felt like I was at one of those extended family/friends gatherings with food that could only be made by . . . a real Italian who puts his heart into it.    I could go on about the dishes last night:  Caprese salad, Brussel sprouts with Italian sausage,  Sfingiolone, THE HOMEMADE BREAD, and the famous pork chop with gorgonzola cream and a side of spaghetti marinara. . . but I hope you try it for yourself.  He's always making new specials from the old country that I've often never heard of and they're delicious and always always fresh.  A very modest, very casual place which looks like a pizza place at lunch, if you come for dinner, it can feel like you're at a much fancier place because of the good vibe and sense of privacy you can get at the farther away from the entrance tables.    If you peek in the kitchen, you'll know HOW FRICKIN CLEAN this place is kept (and I value that a lot)!!   This place has been around for 20 years or more and retains it's commitment to great, fresh, authentic (Pino is from Italy, can't help it) food from PIZZA to their delicious specials and pastas and HOMEMADE BREAD.  Pino's humble always underplaying how great his food is and one of the hardest working owners I've ever met.  He's (almost) Always there cooking, shops for his own fresh food before they open, you'll find him cleaning near close of day etc. etc.    Lucia, his wife and co-owner is sharp as a whip, fun funny and runs the place like clockwork.  WHY this place isn't packed every night is beyond me.  If I lived nearby I couldn't help but frequent it more often.

M0TBH1He3NEptDs3vhXh3Q.text: Had never been here stopped for lunch before my son's Dr appointment. I actually thought it was closed judging by the appearance outside. Ordered a slice of cheese pizza for my son, and a cheese steak for myself. My son got his pizza in a few minutes as he got his order he asked the gentlemen who handed him his pizza for a side of ranch. The cashier yells across its .81 cents. Not a problem paying for extra but everyone in there turned and looked... As I was digging in my purse for the change a man I'm assuming to be the owner walked up and gave him the ranch I offered to pay it but he said no it's ok. I thought it was nice of him. I waited about 15 minutes for my sandwich when it came my son had already finished his pizza which was ok he enjoyed it and was full. He just got the cheese pizza as he is not a fan of toppings, the slices are pretty big, crispy... I didn't eat any so I can't elaborate on it. My cheese steak was pretty big, steak, mushrooms onions and spinach and tons and tons of cheese... I liked that my bread was so crispy and crunchy... I don't think it had much flavor other than cheese... I've had cheese steaks at other places and I can't say that this one was any better than I've had I actually could say I like another places better. At 12 dollars for it... I think I'll stick to my other spot for cheese steak. I'm not saying it was bad... Just not memorable.... The place is decorated nicely, pretty dim.. Bathroom was clean and pretty dim as well. This is not a place I'd come running to... For me and my 12 year old kid... We spent 23 bucks... Not that I can't afford it because I can but it's pricey compared to other places.

photos.caption: Photo of Pino's Pizza Al Centro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese steak

_xflcOc9iY9tOzRSTWlSrQ.text: Little pricy but good service and even better pizza. Pretty casual and chill place to grab some food.

qakFcXeCKYHKUI2RoHSdJQ.text: Love this little gem! All the food is amazing and the service is the best. A few coworkers and I come here every week or so for our lunch hour and are so happy with every experience we have. The pizzas are huge and crafted with just the right amount of ingredients. Usually with pizza places you either get too much sauce or too much crust or maybe even a sauce that isn't *all* there, but this place has it all!

DSvx-9d_w1T7FJdyMi6PBA.text: This place has decent pizza and pasta. It's good for lunch and has room for groups, but it's bit pricey.

5_vK9tFw2iZOAcCEa834fQ.text: My sister & I picked up a small pepperoni pizza & a mixed green salad at Pino's last evening. The pizza was outstanding in flavor & crust. The salad was fresh & delicious with house dressing. I look forward to ordering there again before my trip here has ended. Highly recommend Pino's.

_TmezlQrZHAazc10YVabEQ.text: The pizza was delicious and the owner was friendly.  We were from out of town in a hotel and they were helpful with utensils and additional accouterments.

mn_IZLEIiRuxp12VqBmWNA.text: Delicious.  Best pizza in the neighborhood.  I like Bianco's just fine, but when I want take-out (and Pino's is actually open) this is the place.  It's not cheap, but the quality of the food is supreme.  The antipasto was standout--several quality meats and cheeses and all the rest of the ingredients were unquestionably fresh.  My pizzas have always been perfection--a perfect medium-thin crust with tasty sauce and a compelling combo of cheeses I can't identify.  It's the kind of food you don't feel tempted to gorge on because each bite is savorable and satisfying.  Be sure to call before you show up--their hours are minimalist.  Be prepared to park in one of the neighboring lots as there's not much space.  Bring cash.

kcmx-j6CH2h7s2eGS9rOXw.text: Had an amazing salad and roast beef sandwich on foccacia bread at Pino's. Also had a nice chat with Pino about our trip to Rome. The food is truly like eating in ITALY. Loved it! Forgot to take photos of the delicious food but will do that next time.  One of our favorite places.

ieizj_wDoyVPIs5EwhYCew.text: You wouldn't believe it by the decor or the front. But the smell alone can capture you! We had the Pizza Bianco,  Greek salad and Penne Primevera. The only thing that stopped us from eating was being to full to order more. Nice and friendly too..

DGj-1pa389aqGhv4F_KSBg.text: I wouldn't recommend Pino's for weekday lunches.  The pizza is ok, but for some reason this place has not updated technology enough to accept credit/debit cards, which I think is unacceptable.  At night and on weekends, however, both the pizza and the service get better.  It's definitely worth trying.

P9WTlV3fr_K4q0UzVqrxaw.text: Funny thing is, I've never actually had the pizza here. I have, however, had their pastas. They have a simple spaghetti with olive oil, basil, tomatoes, and grilled chicken and it's pretty tasty. Service is good and they have those great glass bottle sodas like San Pellegrino Aranciata (I prefer the bottle over the can). Their wine list could use some work, but for a small local joint, it's non-pretentious and you hardly ever need to worry about needing reservations.

SGCvl-D7fN4eZbVRJyGHWw.text: This is the pizza of my youth in upstate NY.  The margarita pizza is a home run -- crisp crust, zingy sauce and a perfect amount of sauce.

_eINhHcH18PAKTn1_xr8-Q.text: The food is Amazzzing!!! the service is not. (Order ToGo)

HkWR0EPAXlP44YOfgO3t2g.text: Pino's Pizza you are my new friend downtown.  This place is a traditional mom and pop Italian Pizza Place.  The Pizza is New York Style and is greasy bready flavor explosion delicious.  What surprising to me was how many other items they have on the menu such as pastas, and salads.  They also have dessert and a small but good wine and beer selection.  The prices are just right.  The large pizza is huge! They make it fresh with fresh ingredients.  The service was outstanding and friendly.  One thing I noticed was the owner was there and he knew the names of all his customers.  They have a lot of repeat customers which is makes you feel at home in this place.  I love it and you will too.

aiKl9aSWzAkhM_Ows2nDwA.text: When I used to work across the street at St. Joe's, Pino's was the ultimate bad-day comfort food. Their Greek salad is humongous and amazing, with bursts of flavor from kalamata olives and feta. It's yummy with shredded pizza mozzarella on top too! The bread on the side is fresh and tasty. When I feel like a complete glutton, I go for the calzone, but be warned - it's about three meals' worth of food! The service is always good and everyone is super friendly. I'm not a huge fan of the pizza itself, but not because it's *bad", but because NY style isn't my bag. There's plenty of pasta and sandwiches available though, in addition to calzones and salads - so any discerning palate should be pleased! Oh, yeah - beer and wine only, and the hours can be a little sporadic.

5DT5npJXyI3vDTTs_ICyvA.text: OK, so I came here around noon on a week day with a hankerin for a great slice already in a bit of a bad mood because Mamma Mia on 8th and Indian School was boarded up.  Time was short and I couldn't get to their other location. So I stopped off here--had been before--pizza is OK, nothing great. What gets me is that each slice is 3 bucks--no lunch special. I know, 3 bucks, who cares, whatever. BUT, if you are going to charge that much for a slice, have the decency not to nickel and dime your customers to death for EVERYTHING else. While waiting, one of the seated customers came up to request some extra jalapenos for his sandwich. They charged him for them. When I asked for a cup of water, they told me it was 50 cents...after spending 7 bucks on 2 slices of mediocre pizza. Really? She asked if I wanted napkins when I left. I asked if they were free. She gave me a dirty look.  Not sure why, after what I had witnessed, it was a legitimate question. The food is 2 stars. The nickel and diming--unforgivable. Way too many other places with better slices to waste your time and money at this gouge hut.

Oec2d-wimaYPlmOUrwK-lA.text: Great great great pizza but they're killing me! Don't deliver on the weekends, then I try for a weeknight meal and they don't deliver then either! Just at lunch. Website with info and a menu would be awesome. Just keeping this someplace we order for work lunches.

uqQti4if2hhEzND3xeEGiA.text: I came here to meet some friends who were in the mood for real good pizza, and they heard this was the spot to go. Its a nice little place with good service, and the pizza I had was very good. My friends also got pizza with one of them getting Penne pasta. They all said the food was good as well. And I feel what I got for my money was very good deal.

Xe2pkn9p-Cb21Kno3Iv7lw.text: So this place was one of the many here in downtown that was just super hyped up to me. First- I EXPECTED a pizza joint... not a restaurant. WAY underdressed, lemme tell ya! So maybe that just set me up all wrong. I didn't think the pizza was ALL that great. Not the incredible, gotta get it before it's gone, it's so worth the long lines (which there weren't).. mumbo jumbo I got. I will definitely go again (nicely dressed, and prepared for a restaurant), and perhaps I will have a better review. But as of now, it gets a 3..  I like the lack of servers though. I would have been really disappointed if I was all bum-lookin' and a server offered me a drink! lol Although I can see how that counter could be way over crowded at a busy time of day.

UrYqpKpJ08Rbc3HkLgnUOQ.text: Delicious thin crust pizza at reasonable prices. We had the carnivore, split  a salad and 2 glasses of wine for about $26. The wait staff is very friendly . We will definitely go back when we are in the neighborhood.

GsX5VhkJ9j7k46MKx57N1Q.text: I stopped by Pinos today in hopes of trying it but to my dismay they do not take Visa unless the bill is over $25.00 bummer!!  So, one day when I happen to have cash will be the day I get to try it.

E60hw7N-Q-xWlpQRAHNEyA.text: Horrible customer service!!!!  I purchased a huge calzone using my debit card.  I noticed i had1 small container of pizza sauce after the transaction so I requested 1 additional sauce.  They wanted to charge me 55 cents which i did not have because I dont usually carry cash.  I could only use my debit card for a 10.00 or more purchase so that was out.  They weren't even customer service oriented enough to offer the sauce free of charge this one time.  I will not ever eat at this establishment again.

Pb-PMuwLHoJ4lsT6TXFknA.text: I love Pino's for both dinner and lunch. They operate as an order at the counter type of place at lunch, and then at dinner utilize waiter service. When I lived in the neighborhood, I used to eat 2-3 calzones a week here. They also feature a couple of specials every night, and you should definitely order whatever the special is. His New York Style Hamburger is nothing short of amazing. The parking situation sucks, as they only have about 6 spaces for a restaurant that gets busy every night of the week. They hours are lame as well, M-F 11-2 and 5-8.... Pino... you gotta stay up later! To sum it up, the food is incredible, and they have a nice little beer/wine list, but just be aware of the short hours, small parking lot, and no cash policy.

MbVH-m8VexuEdxRVmrn85Q.text: While it's nearly next door to Z Pizza it couldn't be farther from what they offer.  The pizza is New York style and is a nice change from the anemic California style offered at Z Pizza.  They offer calzone and I'm a huge fan.

Z4gFuKR5UfWVG_rJSoYaeg.text: Outstanding Italian!  Great specials every day.  Flat out a can't beat place!

HvBuQIW7etzPGc73Kfrv_Q.text: Pinos restaurant is outstanding! I have only been there twice,  once to sit and  twice to get  take out dessert on my brithday, The second time the owner was kind enough to talk to me a long time about italy, his family, food etc. I always find that scores big points with me when the owner mingles with guests. The pizza is right up there with the few best places in Phx if you like Ny pizza( oil on top and all) I had a salad too. It came with fochaccia which I did not think was great,  but I  like the Garlic or Rosemary kind, so freepass there. TIRIMUSO- I have had it all over the world, since sadly I am addicted to the stuff, and this is one of the top two I have had. EXCELLENT! If I weren't in public I would have licked the plate clean.TEEHEEE- On my birthday I did lick the stryofoam container clean since I was in the privacy of my own home-teehee! The service is good here too.I went early so missed the crowd. ( Like 5pm on a weekday)  The man from France helped me on both occassions and he is very nice. It cracks me up, strikes me funny, that an Italian restaurant has a french waiter, I like that! Keep up the great job people of Pinos. YUMMY!

lUoGDS3o4zElZdR5xT2COQ.text: This place has amazing pizza. It's been around for like 20 years and once you try it you immediately understand why.

7Nmk8x5Lt4ZTgMm_C9YPpQ.text: For slices, they only have a cheese thin crust, and a Sicilian. One day they only had the cheese thin crust which was strange. They should definitely have more options for customers.  The pizza is okay, the Sicilian is slightly better. The desserts were definitely tastier than the pizza. My coworked loved their Tiramisu, while I loved their Cannoli! We'll be back for the desserts for sure!   The place is decorated with a mix of pop art and Italian rustic charm. It would seem more authentic with less pop art, and more Italian art.  Oh and there's a real candle in the restroom which is a nice touch, especially since people lean towards electric candles nowadays.

photos.caption: Photo of Pino's Pizza Al Centro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Daily Specials.
Photo of Pino's Pizza Al Centro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside.
Photo of Pino's Pizza Al Centro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Slice of the thin crust.

TAQGCa4Nnzpyzc3pLgzzow.text: Alli approved A+ I think I found my slice of heaven! After hearing about this place for several years from my brother we went to the family owned restaurant down the street perfectly nestled away in downtown. I haven't stopped going since, the space is larger than I expected and it is decorated tastefully and very clean!! The owner was greeting customers with the staff in a laid back manner which made me instantly comfortable. After sitting down we were quickly waited on by an exceptional waitress and I ordered a wonderful glass of a white moscato as it was Monday and I earned it. We ordered a classic cheese pizza and the BEST chicken parmigiana sandwich EVER. I've had a lot of parm in my life and this was amazing. The chicken was not breaded and not too thick or hard to bite. I could take a bite and have just the right proportion of cheese, chicken, amazing sauce and the lightest yet crisp bread which made for the best sandwich ever. It was so good but I still tried the pizza and I'm ruined... No other place will ever be like Pinos! I've been back weekly since and look forward to going again soon. I really have to try some of the specials though including some pastas, I did see a few that looked amazing but I can't cheat on my parm.. Cheers to the restaurant we all want to find - just leave room for me when you're too packed to seat anyone else because word gets around how amazing the food and ambience really is.

photos.caption: Photo of Pino's Pizza Al Centro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Penne Boscaiola with cream... yes!
Photo of Pino's Pizza Al Centro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lasagna *Special* amazing
Photo of Pino's Pizza Al Centro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Parmigiana Sandwich

DWWCig_XNDioPntEKRC1mg.text: I'm new to the area and was very excited to try. I ordered a pepperoni pizza. It was decent, good but not great. It was too greasy, not a pizza to brag about!!!

Pj7gy5L0tJyM49YgtNCXFQ.text: While on a business trip a group of us discovered this gem just off the main area of downtown Phoenix. We ordered at the counter and seated ourselves. I split the turkey panini with two girls and had to indulge in a small cannoli. The sandwich portion was huge and perfect to share! I'm not a fan of ranch dressing but the ladies are and we ordered it on the side for dipping (comes in the sandwich).   We were a group of 7 who staggered in slightly apart, all placed separate orders and came together at one table. Food was delicious and this was a great find for satisfying food and drink in a long day of meetings.

photos.caption: Photo of Pino's Pizza Al Centro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Got into a great conversation regarding the origin of this wine. It was light, smooth and fruity without being sweet, great red!
Photo of Pino's Pizza Al Centro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh bread, meats and cheeses in balsamic. Perfection with the wine! Owner brought this out to accompany our wine. Beautiful.
Photo of Pino's Pizza Al Centro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dessert first! This is the small cannoli with a glass or red recommended by owner.

PPAZsq1vXq2h138GM9r4nw.text: I am now a regular for lunch, often late lunch. The pizza is amazing. I feel like I'm cheating on my regular pizza joint in Gilbert. The pizza is amazing. I keep meaning to try other things, but I keep coming for a quick slice. I love this place. The ingredients are quality. I think it's organic flour as I don't react to it. The cheese is great? Which this WI girl likes. Quality ingredients, quality pizza. Yum. Maybe next time I will get a pic.

GJh4krvL_nPMzPxNTE2HEA.text: I was back in mid town Phoenix again and returned back to Pino's. Their food is very authentic with fantastic flavor and their server was great. Very friendly staff and Pino came out personally said hello to us. I highly recommend eating at Pino's.

cK0E3f3plRCZrZOvJ39-lQ.text: My favorite food is Italian and I went to Pinos Pizza and hands down best food ever! The staff very friendly and the owner is so sweet and very friendly! Wil recipient to everyone i know... and what do you know all my friends work at St Joseph's hospital... Thank you Pino for the extra desserts

YTtonxv9GISEyNOLaKvHmw.text: By far my favorite place to get pizza. Love their white pizza and caprese salad. My 5 year old never eats the crust off pizza, until now. Only been here twice...but it was twice in less than two week period.

x_u1FtVBxnray7-f3YLD4Q.text: Love the pizza unfortunately the customer service is extremely slacking. I made a delivery through door dash that included two pizzas and one salad. The receipt showed that we ordered a salad but when door dash delivered we did not receive our salad. Management denied that we had ordered a salad even though our receipt showed it and we were charged for it. They did offer a door dash credit but we were really wanting the salad. They were suggesting that we were lying about the salad too. We will not be ordering Pino's for delivery ever again.

AnvSgRUcoYXBBuIOPc-j5Q.text: They don't have the pasta pizza anymore! So much sadness. I got a non pasta pizza with pepperoni and ricotta.... Cost about 15$..... Tasted like it should've cost closer to 10. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't as good as other pizza places in the area where you can get a tasty pie (with more toppings) for less.

9X3RWJUS_Qmr1BPgmfm9SQ.text: I found this place because of Yelp!  I sought out to find "really good pizza by the slice" and this place came up.  I love pizza!  It's one of my favorite foods.  To me Federal Pizza has some of the best pizza in the Valley.  This would come in second for me.  1 slice is huge!  Not like the $5 slices you pick up in DC huge but bigger than a normal slice of pizza.  The waitress asked if I were ordering more than one slice.  She said, "if you are then you should just order a 10 inch pizza because of the price".  One slice was almost 6 bucks, a 10 inch was around 10 bucks and change I believe.  Next time I'll just go with the 10 inch.    I ordered the pepperoni and sausage slice.  Homemade sausage might I add.  Man ... it was soooooooo good and pippin hot.  Note to self and others:  Let it set for longer than 2 minutes before you try and take a bite.  Trust me!

photos.caption: Photo of Pino's Pizza Al Centro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Piping hot and delicious!!! Pepperoni and homemade sausage slice!!
Photo of Pino's Pizza Al Centro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. To go menu

xcl49pHwbHCl5jWWdAGMKg.text: Really bad customer service. Some coworkers and I went in on a pizza ($28.50 for a large Margherita pizza!!!) and we're told they won't deliver for less than $30. Okay... so we're basically at $30 after tax and tip we're over... but nope. Not budging... we must order more before they'll deliver. "Do you want a cannoli?" she asks. No. We do not want a cannoli, so we order a drink. We've achieved their iron clad minimum. She tells us it will be 30 minutes, okay sounds good. It's 11:10 when she tells us that.... smash cut to 12:55 and we're still waiting for our $28.50 pizza. (By the way... a Margherita pizza is cheese and basil. Imagine if we had actual toppings) The pizza finally arrives and it's congealed and cold and the drink doesn't have a single ice cube left. I call and tell her that it took 3 times longer than she said and the pizza is now cold. She says, oh sorry. Okaaay... well we're not happy and would like some compensation at this point. "I'll talk to my manager" *wait on hold for awhile*  She picks back up "Pino's, how can I help you?". I remind her what's going on and she says "oh, I thought I accidentally hung up on you". *back on hold.......* She picks up and says that she talked to the manager and he said because we took the food they won't do anything and that we should've picked it up if we wanted hot pizza. So, basically it's our fault. By the way, I've eaten here before and the pizza is really good... but apparently it has a window because today's experience is a deal breaker. Sucks to pay so much for a cold congealed pizza that you waited almost two hours for. And then to receive such POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE on top of it??! Bye.

BGzA9f3EqffKW3LiQgCpUA.text: I thought this place was pretty good. I had cheese pizza and the man and kids had pepperoni. Everyone seemed to really enjoy the pizza. I think it could have been cooked just a little longer. The service was a little off to me. There were 3 people upfront when I went to get my to go order the what seemed to be manager or owner was a little harsh. She was standing over the younger girl who you could tell was either new or just nervous from this women. She was right behind her staring as she ran my card. She then told her after 2 beeps  " you've got to pull the card faster" wow I would hate to work for this lady! A nice man opened the door for me that worked there on the way out but the experience in there was not a very good one. But the food was good.  I'll go back for the food   and how close it is to my place. But service is big to me and I was not a fan of the service or the parking lot!
